chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes: To perform  20  hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency per year of probation.

11:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite in court for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago. Lorena Mongin sworn to interpret. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1,2 & 4.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of cts. 1,2 &4. Counts 3 & 5 dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond no longer in effect.
Plea Questionnaire and Addendum

11:05 AM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite appeared by video for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago. Lorena Mongin sworn, interprets via zoom for defendant.  Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to modify bond.  Further discussion.  State moves to withdraw their motion to amend bond.  So ordered, by Court.   Atty Van Rite indicates they hope to resolve all pending matters at 8/09/22 hearing.  Court requests interpreter be present in person for 8/09/22 hearing.  Lorena Mongin will be present in court in person on 8/09/22.  Bond remains in effect.
Motion hearing on June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Lorena Mongin will interpret via zoom for 6/24/22 hearing at 11 AM.    Zoom instructions emailed to Lorena.
9:15 AM    Court could not connect to zoom   After talking to CCAP, Zoom is out nationwide.  Court will have JA Wiegand reschedule hearing.  Interpreter cancelled via email.
Lorena Mongin scheduled to interpret on 6/21/22 at 9:00 AM.  Zoom instructions emailed 6/15/22.
Motion to Modify bond with ADL attachments
Motion hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Lorena Mongin scheduled to interpret in person on 8/9/22 at 11:20.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

9:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago in court.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite in court for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago. Lorena Mongin sworn, interprets. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Van Rite indicates defendant will waive right to prelim. Court goes in brief recess.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:20 am.
to Brown County DA's Office

Susan Rascon sworn to interpret. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives time limits for prelim. Court finds waiver being made freely, intelligently and voluntarily.  Atty Van Rite requests status. Bond remains in effect.
